title: Expand dangerous bash command patterns
description:
hook_block_dangerous_bash() has limited pattern coverage.

**Current patterns:**
- rm -rf, sudo, chmod 777, mkfs, dd if=, > /dev/

**Missing dangerous patterns:**
- Fork bombs: :(){ :|: &};:
- eval and backticks
- Command substitution $()
- Network commands (nc, telnet, curl POST)
- Environment manipulation

**Files:**
- R/hooks.R (lines 434-441)

title: Add hook timeout and multi-agent delegation tests
description:
Missing test coverage for:

**Hook timeouts:**
- Timeout behavior when callr runs hook
- Hook callback timeout failure recovery

**Multi-agent delegation:**
- Sub-agent errors and recovery
- Unknown agent name handling
- Model mismatch scenarios
- Skill loading failures in sub-agents

**Files:**
- tests/testthat/test-hooks.R
- tests/testthat/test-agents-multi.R

title: Review implementation parity with claude-agent-sdk
description:
Compare deputy implementation against claude-agent-sdk (Python) to ensure feature parity and identify gaps.

**Areas to review:**

1. **Hook System**
   - Event types (PreToolUse, PostToolUse, Stop, UserPromptSubmit, PreCompact)
   - Hook result types and fields
   - Hook matching patterns

2. **Permission System**
   - Permission modes (default, acceptEdits, readonly, bypassPermissions)
   - Permission callbacks
   - Tool annotation support

3. **Agent Execution**
   - Streaming vs batch execution
   - Turn limits, cost limits
   - Interruption handling

4. **Multi-Agent**
   - Agent definitions
   - Delegation patterns
   - Model inheritance

5. **Missing Features**
   - Any SDK features not yet in deputy
   - API differences that may cause confusion

**Repository:** https://github.com/anthropics/claude-agent-sdk

title: Improve documentation for hooks and tool annotations
description:
Several documentation gaps identified:

**Hook context:**
- Document what's in the context parameter for each hook type
- Add examples showing context structure

**Tool annotations:**
- Central documentation of all available annotations
- read_only_hint, destructive_hint, open_world_hint
- Default values and effects

**Compaction:**
- Document how summaries are generated
- PreCompact hook timing clarification

**Files:**
- R/hooks.R
- R/permissions.R
- R/agent.R
- man/*.Rd

title: Validate skill provider requirements
description:
Skills can specify provider requirements in SKILL.yaml but these aren't validated.

**Current:**
- Only package requirements are checked (lines 71-77 in skills.R)

**Expected:**
- Validate that required providers (openai, anthropic, etc.) are available
- Warn or error if skill is loaded without required provider

**Files:**
- R/skills.R

title: Detect skill tool name conflicts
description:
When loading skills, tool name conflicts are silently overwritten.

**Current:**
- Lines 446-448 in skills.R silently overwrite tools with same name

**Expected:**
- Warn on duplicate tool names
- Consider erroring or providing conflict resolution options

**Files:**
- R/skills.R

title: Implement LLM-based conversation compaction
description:
The compact() method in agent.R currently uses simple text concatenation instead of LLM summarization.

**Current behavior:**
- Lines 502-504 in agent.R use basic text joining
- Produces poor summaries that lose important context

**Expected behavior:**
- Use LLM to generate meaningful conversation summaries
- Preserve key context and decisions from compacted turns

**Files:**
- R/agent.R (compact method)

title: Add tool result type validation
description:
The on_tool_result callback has minimal validation of tool result structure.

**Risk:**
- Malformed ContentToolResult objects could crash the agent

**Files:**
- R/agent.R (on_tool_result callback, lines 602-635)

title: Add S7 Turn mock support for generator tests
description:
Current mock chat doesn't provide proper S7 Turn objects that the generator expects.

**Impact:**
- Generator tests are superficial
- Can't validate turn event generation properly

**Solution:**
- Create sophisticated mock that returns proper ellmer Turn objects
- Or use vcr to record/replay real API responses

**Files:**
- tests/testthat/helper-mocks.R
- tests/testthat/test-agent-execution.R

title: Examine posit-dev/btw for tool reuse opportunities
description:
Review the posit-dev/btw repository for inspiration and potential tool reuse.

**Goals:**
- Identify tools in btw that could be reused or adapted
- Compare tool implementations and patterns
- Evaluate if we can depend on btw directly vs copying/adapting
- Look for patterns we're missing

**Areas to examine:**
- File operation tools
- Code execution tools
- Data analysis tools
- Any R-specific tooling patterns

**Repository:** https://github.com/posit-dev/btw

title: Improve symlink and path traversal handling
description:
Path validation has edge cases that aren't fully handled.

**Issues:**
- Relative symlinks that escape directories not blocked
- Home directory expansion (~) could bypass restrictions
- Symlink chains not fully resolved
- Race conditions between check and use (TOCTOU)

**Files:**
- R/utils.R (is_path_within, has_path_traversal)
- R/permissions.R
